mk_reactable

mk_reactable.Rd

mk_reactable

mk_reactable(
  data,
  resizable = TRUE,
  filterable = TRUE,
  searchable = TRUE,
  defaultPageSize = 10,
  borderless = TRUE,
  striped = TRUE,
  highlight = TRUE,
  fullWidth = TRUE,
  width = 1200,
  theme = reactable::reactableTheme(cellPadding = "0px 8px"),
  ...
)

Arguments

data

A data frame or matrix to obtain variables.such as 'iris' data set.
resizable

A character string to define the criteria to enable columns resizing.
filterable

A character string to define the criteria to enable columns filtering.
searchable

A character string to define the criteria to enable global table searching.
defaultPageSize

A character string to define the Page size options for the table.
borderless

A character string to remove inner borders from table.
striped

A character string to add zebra-striping to table rows.
highlight

A character string to highlight table rows on hover.
fullWidth

Stretch the table to fill the full width of its container? Defaults to TRUE.
width

Width of the table in pixels. Defaults to "auto" for automatic sizing.
theme

Theme options for the table. The default value is reactableTheme(cellPadding = "0px 8px"): No padding between two cells (ensure no break line between reference line)
...

Additional arguments transferred to reactable.

Value

an interactive data table.

Details

This function is used to create a data table from tabular data with sorting and pagination by default. The reactable configuration follows https://glin.github.io/reactable/reference/reactable.html The data table is an HTML widget that can be used in R Markdown documents and Shiny applications, or viewed from an R console.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
mk_reactable(iris[1:5, ], resizable = TRUE, filterable = TRUE, 
             searchable = TRUE, defaultPageSize = 10,
             borderless = TRUE, striped = TRUE, highlight = TRUE)
}
